# **FROM v4 and up!**

Unified nodes:
- üé§ **TTS Text**: Direct text-to-speech module  
- üîÑ **Voice Changer**: Voice transformation  
- üì∫ **TTS SRT**: Subtitle-compatible TTS output  

These nodes are now **engine-agnostic**, meaning you can plug in **Chatterbox**, **F5**, or future engines seamlessly.

üîÑ **Voice Changer** supports both **Chatterbox** and **VCR**, giving you more versatility in voice manipulation.

# Tips

## General Use (Chatterbox TTS and Voice Agents):

- The default settings (`exaggeration=0.5`, `cfg_weight=0.5`) work well for most prompts.
- If the reference speaker has a fast speaking style, lowering `cfg_weight` to around `0.3` can improve pacing.

## Expressive or Dramatic Speech:

- Try lower `cfg_weight` values (e.g. ~`0.3`) and increase `exaggeration` to around `0.7` or higher.
- Higher `exaggeration` tends to speed up speech; reducing `cfg_weight` helps compensate with slower, more deliberate pacing.

## **‚ùó ‚ùó  This is a LONG example with multi-character switching + language switching + pause system.**

Be warned that connecting this text will take a long time to generate and will download and load multiple ChatterBox models

# üõ°Ô∏è ChatterBox Crash Protection System

ChatterBox has a bug where text shorter than ~21 characters causes CUDA tensor errors that can crash ComfyUI. The crash protection system automatically pads short text segments to prevent these crashes.

## How It Works

- **Template**: `"hmm ,, {seg} hmm ,,"` (default)
- **Trigger**: Activates when text segments are too short
- **Process**: Replaces `{seg}` with original text: `"hello"` ‚Üí `"hmm ,, hello hmm ,,"`

## Configuration

Set the crash protection template on the **ChatterBox Engine** node:

- **Default**: `"hmm ,, {seg} hmm ,,"`
- **Custom**: `"Well, {seg}"`, `"...ummmmm {seg}"`, `"{seg}... yes... {seg}"`
- **Disable**: Leave empty string `""`

# üé≠  **Chatterbox Voice Tips**

1- For **Chatterbox**, you can connect any audio from a **Load Audio Core** node directly for **zero-shot voice cloning**
 
2- or use the **üé≠ Character Voices** feature to load a narrator from your `Voices` folder.

üé≠ **Character Voices** can also be connected to the **Voice Changer** for dynamic voice cloning in Voice Changer when using Chatterbox Engine.

Hello everyone. My name is Dima. I want to tell you about the AI video creation 
and editing I can offer. Unlike other services where you only get a few attempts, I can deliver exactly what you're looking for. For example, if you want to add just a blue bird specifically right here, I can do that. Maybe you need something more ambitious, like an elephant walking through the scene. Why not? Need to remove something? No problem!

Welcome to our multilingual storytelling demonstration. Today we explore the advanced capabilities of modern text-to-speech technology with seamless character and language switching.

[Narrator] In a bustling international caf√©, conversations flow between languages and voices.[pause:2s] Let me tell you about what happened yesterday.

Hvordan har du det i dag? [crestfallen_original] Even the Norwegian gentleman couldn't help but join the conversation.

[pause:1.5s][Alice] It's fascinating how [en:Alice] we can switch between languages so naturally, [de:Alice] aber manchmal ist es schwierig [en:Alice] to find the right words in each language.

[crestfallen_original] The conversation continued as [Girl] Oh, I completely understand! [crestfallen_original] said a young woman nearby, [Girl] Sometimes I think in English but [de:Girl] meine Tr√§ume sind auf Deutsch [Girl] and it gets quite confusing!

[pause:2s][Cowboy] Well partner, [crestfallen_original] interrupted a distinctive voice from the corner, [Cowboy] back in my day we had to learn languages the hard way. [crestfallen_original] The man's weathered face told stories of [Cowboy] countless adventures across different lands and cultures.

[Bob] Det er veldig interessant! [crestfallen_original] he replied thoughtfully, [no:Bob] Men n√• med moderne teknologi [en:Bob] we can preserve and share these voices across the world.

[pause:1s][Old Man] You know, [crestfallen_original] began an elderly gentleman, [Old Man] I've lived through the transition from [no:Old Man] n√•r vi bare hadde radio [en:Old Man] to this incredible digital age where [Old Man] voices can be recreated and shared instantly.

[Alice] Das stimmt! [crestfallen_original] Alice nodded enthusiastically, [de:Alice] Meine Gro√ümutter w√ºrde das nicht glauben [en:Alice] if she could see how we communicate today. [Alice] The technology bridges generations and cultures.

[pause:2.5s][crestfallen_original] As the afternoon progressed, the conversation became even more animated. [Girl] Did you hear about the new developments? [crestfallen_original] she asked excitedly, [Girl] They say we can now capture the essence of any voice and [Girl] make it speak in multiple languages perfectly!

[Cowboy] That's mighty impressive, [crestfallen_original] the cowboy drawled, [Cowboy] reminds me of those old radio shows where [Cowboy] one person would voice multiple characters. [crestfallen_original] His eyes twinkled with nostalgia.

[pause:1s][Bob] N√∏yaktig! [crestfallen_original] Bob agreed, [no:Bob] Det er som √• ha et teaterensemble [en:Bob] right in your pocket. [Bob] The possibilities for storytelling are endless.

[no:Alice] Det er utrolig! [crestfallen_original] Alice switched to Norwegian, [no:Alice] Vi kan n√• fortelle historier p√• s√• mange m√•ter [en:Alice] and reach audiences we never imagined before.

[pause:3s][Narrator] The caf√© slowly emptied as evening approached, but the conversation had sparked something special. [crestfallen_original] Each person left with [Old Man] a new appreciation for how technology [crestfallen_original] was preserving and expanding [Girl] the beautiful diversity of human speech [crestfallen_original] while bringing people together across linguistic barriers.

[Cowboy] Until we meet again, partners, [crestfallen_original] the cowboy tipped his hat, [Cowboy] remember that every voice tells a story worth hearing.

[pause:1.5s][Alice] Auf Wiedersehen! [Bob] Ha det bra! [Girl] See you all soon! [Old Man] Take care everyone! [crestfallen_original] And with that, the multicultural symphony of voices faded into the evening air.

[pause:2s][Narrator] This is the power of modern voice technology. [pause:1s] Not just converting text to speech, but preserving the rich tapestry of human expression across languages, cultures, and generations. [pause:1s] Every voice matters, every language counts, and every story deserves to be heard.

[pause:3s][crestfallen_original] The future of communication is here, and it speaks with the voices of humanity itself.

Hello! This is unified TTS with character switching support.
[Alice] Hi there! I'm Alice speaking with the selected TTS engine.
[Bob] And I'm Bob! This works with any TTS engine.
Back to the main narrator voice for the conclusion.
